result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:30 PM Defendant Michael James Holden appears in Court, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin. DE plans to retain counsel. Court notes this was set for a PH but DE does not have counsel. Court will reset this matter but will set a STC first to be sure DE has counsel. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:35 pm.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY
NO POSSESSION OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES WITHOUT A VALID PRESCRIPTION

03:11 PM Defendant Michael James Holden appears via videoconferencing from PCJ with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson via phone.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Constitutional rights explained to Defendant.  State requests $5,000 signature bond w/conditions of AS and NPOC.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested and advises of additional standard charges. PD will not be involved.  Court questions Defendant's address, phone and dob.  Adjourned at 3:18 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
